title: Thunderstorm Safety: Weather the Storm
description: Learn how to prepare for, stay safe during, and recover from thunderstorms to ensure your safety and well-being.

sections.title: Before a Thunderstorm
sections.content:
## Preparation

- **Identify a Sturdy Building**: Plan to shelter in a basement or a small, interior, windowless room on the lowest level.
- **Practice Drills**: Conduct drills with your household to ensure everyone knows where to go and what to do.
- **Stay Connected**: Sign up for emergency alerts and have a battery-powered radio.
- **Learn Emergency Skills**: Learn First Aid and CPR.
- **Protect Your Home**: Secure outdoor items, trim trees, and clean gutters. Consider installing a sump pump if your home is prone to flooding.

sections.title: During a Thunderstorm
sections.content:
## Immediate Actions

- **Seek Shelter**: When you hear thunder, go indoors immediately and stay away from windows and doors.
- **Avoid Electrical Devices**: Do not use devices connected to electrical outlets.
- **Avoid Water**: Lightning can travel through plumbing.
- **Stay Informed**: Monitor weather alerts and updates.
- **Vehicle Safety**: If caught outside, move to a safe shelter. If driving, pull off the road in a safe location.

sections.title: After a Thunderstorm
sections.content:
## Recovery

- **Avoid Fallen Power Lines**: Report them to the utility company immediately.
- **Expect Power Outages**: Use battery-powered lights and avoid candles.
- **Prevent Carbon Monoxide Poisoning**: Use generators and grills outdoors and away from windows.
- **Food Safety**: Discard food that got wet or warm.
